result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon B. Jacque was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

to Jon B. Jacque - Letter and Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture - no forwarding address

Defendant Jon B. Jacque in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Plea agreement put into the record.    Victim rights complied.  Plea of no contest to15CM10 count 2 - obstructing an officer.  Case No. 15CT27 - Plea of no contest to Count 1 - OWI 3rd.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of 15CM10 to count 2 obstructing an Officer and Case No. 15CT27 - Count 1.  Court dismisses and read in count 1 in 15CM10 and count 2 in 15CT27 and dismisses count 3 in 15CT27.  Case No. 15CM10 - court orders $100.00 fine plus costs and DNA surcharge.  Case No. 15CT27 - court orders $2,505.00 fine; 160 days county jail with huber and good time consecutive to any other sentence; 28 month revocation of driver's license; IID: $41.00 blood draw; AODA.  The fines are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning 30 days after release from custody.  - rt

Taylor County Arrest Report

Court calls case 15CT27 and 15CM10.  Defendant Jon Ryan Jacque in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrants to be quashed. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions of:  Booking; not to consume or possess alcohol, must not operate a vehicle without a valide driver's license. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for October 20, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  Court orders clerk to commence bond revocation on 15CM10. Court addresses unpaid court obligations and child support warrant. ba
Attorney Alec Phillip Nocco in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by Jon Jacque.  Court issues a body only bench warrant for Mr. Jacque.  - rt

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Jon B. Jacque in court, in custody by phone from Clark County Jail.  Attorney Justin D. Wolff in court for defendant. Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tlusty calls case. DE states he did not receive a copy of the complaint. Therefore, Atty. Wolff requests a formal reading. Court advises DE of the charges and penalties. Atty. Wolff entered a plea of not guilty. Pretrial conference scheduled for 3-11-15 at 9:15 a.m. State requested current bond to continue. So ordered by the Court. ap

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with A.L.R. dob: 9-16-1989.
arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jon R. Jacque appeared in court by video conference.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with A.L.R. - dob:  9-16-89.  Court ordered bond as requested by the district attorney.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is an initial appearance on January 27, 2015 at 1:-00 p.m.  - rt
